poem:
Theatrical Pause

Among seats of power  
the laughter drifts,  
echoes of wit entwine  
with the melancholy grace  
of stage shadows.  
Maggie's spirit lingers,  
unraveling the silk thread  
of time unbound—  
where presidents tarry,  
waiting for lines unseen,  
their grandeur softened  
by the gentle sigh  
of life's unfolding play.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Maggie Smith remembered by David Hare “Melancholy men, of all others, are the most witty,” said Aristotle, in an observation that will resonate with anyone who spent time with Maggie Smith. At the turn of the century, I wrote a play, The Breath of Life, in which Maggie appeared opposite Judi Dench. One night at the Theatre Royal Haymarket, Hillary Clinton came with Madeleine Albright.
